title: Neto (footballer, born 1989)
text:
Norberto Murara Neto (born 19 July 1989), commonly known as Neto (), is a Brazilian professional <a href="association%20football">footballer</a> who plays as a <a href="goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a> for <a href="La%20Liga">La Liga</a> club <a href="FC%20Barcelona">Barcelona</a>.
Neto began his career with Brazilian side <a href="Club%20Athletico%20Paranaense">Athletico Paranaense</a> and later played for Italian side <a href="ACF%20Fiorentina">Fiorentina</a>. He joined Juventus in 2015, where he won the <a href="Double%20%28association%20football%29%23Italy">domestic double</a> in each of his two seasons with the club, serving as a back-up to starter <a href="Gianluigi%20Buffon">Gianluigi Buffon</a> in the league, but appearing in all of the club's games in both of their victorious <a href="Coppa%20Italia">Coppa Italia</a> campaigns. In 2017, he joined Spanish side <a href="Valencia%20CF">Valencia</a>. On 27 June 2019 <a href="FC%20Barcelona">Barcelona</a> announced Neto's signing.
He was first called up for Brazil in 2010, but did not make his debut until 2018. He won a silver medal at the <a href="Football%20at%20the%202012%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20tournament">2012 Olympics</a> and was part of Brazil's squad at the <a href="2015%20Copa%20Am%C3%A9rica">2015 Copa América</a>.
Club career.
Athlético Paranaense.
Born in <a href="Arax%C3%A1">Araxá</a>, <a href="Minas%20Gerais">Minas Gerais</a>, Neto was installed as <a href="Club%20Athletico%20Paranaense">Athletico Paranaense</a>'s first-choice goalkeeper for the <a href="2010%20Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20A">2010</a> <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20A">Brazilian Série A</a> season. After being sent off in the first match of the campaign and serving a two-match suspension, he returned and started every game for the club until October, when he was forced to miss several games after being called up for the <a href="Brazil%20national%20football%20team">Brazil national team</a>.
Fiorentina.
Neto agreed a deal to play for Italian club <a href="ACF%20Fiorentina">Fiorentina</a> on 5 January 2011, signing the contract three days later.
He made his competitive debut for Fiorentina in the 4th round of the <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Coppa%20Italia">2011–12 Coppa Italia</a> on 24 November 2011 against fellow <a href="Tuscany">Tuscans</a> <a href="Empoli%20F.C.">Empoli</a>, winning 2–1.
On 3 May 2014, he played in the <a href="2014%20Coppa%20Italia%20Final">Coppa Italia Final</a>, which Fiorentina lost 3–1 to <a href="SSC%20Napoli">Napoli</a>.
Juventus.
Neto joined <a href="Juventus%20F.C.">Juventus</a> on a four-year contract on 3 July 2015. On 23 September 2015, Neto made his Juventus debut, starting in a 1–1 home draw against <a href="Frosinone%20Calcio">Frosinone</a> in Serie A. On 16 December 2015, Neto achieved his first clean sheet with the club in a 4–0 win over <a href="Derby%20della%20Mole">cross-city rivals</a> <a href="Torino%20F.C.">Torino</a> during a <a href="2015%E2%80%9316%20Coppa%20Italia">Coppa Italia</a> match. He kept his first clean sheet in the league in the club's final match of the season, on 14 May 2016, which ended in a 5–0 home win over <a href="U.C.%20Sampdoria">Sampdoria</a>, as Juventus celebrated their Serie A title victory. On 21 May, he kept another clean sheet to win the <a href="2016%20Coppa%20Italia%20Final">Coppa Italia</a> 1–0 against <a href="A.C.%20Milan">A.C. Milan</a> in Rome's <a href="Stadio%20Olimpico">Stadio Olimpico</a>.
In his second season with the club, Neto made his <a href="2016%E2%80%9317%20UEFA%20Champions%20League">UEFA Champions League</a> debut on 7 December 2016, in Juventus's final group match, keeping a clean sheet in a 2–0 home win over <a href="GNK%20Dinamo%20Zagreb">Dinamo Zagreb</a>. Although he served as a back-up to Buffon in the league, he was Juventus's starting goalkeeper in the <a href="2016%E2%80%9317%20Coppa%20Italia">Coppa Italia</a>, featuring in all of the club's matches in the competition, including the 2–0 victory over <a href="S.S.%20Lazio">Lazio</a> in the <a href="2017%20Coppa%20Italia%20Final">final</a> on 17 May 2017, as Juventus won their 12th Coppa Italia title, becoming the first team to win three consecutive championships and league-cup doubles.
Valencia.
On 7 July 2017, Neto joined <a href="Valencia%20CF">Valencia</a> on a four-year contract in a €7 million deal, plus an additional €2 million in conditional bonuses. He made his debut for the club on 18 August, starting in a 1–0 <a href="La%20Liga">La Liga</a> home win against <a href="UD%20Las%20Palmas">Las Palmas</a>.
Barcelona.
On 27 June 2019, it was announced that Neto would move to <a href="FC%20Barcelona">Barcelona</a> for €26m plus €9m in add-ons. One day earlier, Barcelona backup goalkeeper <a href="Jasper%20Cillessen">Jasper Cillessen</a> left Barcelona for €35m to take Neto's spot as the starting goalkeeper for <a href="Valencia%20CF">Valencia</a>. 
On 10 December 2019 Neto played the full 90 minutes as Barca knocked out <a href="Inter%20Milan">Inter Milan</a> out of the <a href="2019-20%20UEFA%20Champions%20League">2019-20 UEFA Champions League</a>.
Neto played in Barcelona's first six <a href="2020-21%20La%20Liga">league</a> games and three of the six <a href="2020-21%20UEFA%20Champions%20League%20group%20stage%23Group%20G">UEFA Champions League group stage</a> matches in the absence of first-choice keeper <a href="Marc-Andr%C3%A9%20ter%20Stegen">Marc-André ter Stegen</a>, who was out with a knee injury until the end of October.
International career.
Neto was in the <a href="Brazil%20national%20under-23%20football%20team">Brazil squad</a> for the <a href="Football%20at%20the%202012%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20tournament">2012 Olympic tournament</a>, playing in their two opening <a href="Football%20at%20the%202012%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20tournament%20%E2%80%93%20Group%20C">group stage</a> wins over <a href="Egypt%20national%20under-23%20football%20team">Egypt</a> and <a href="Belarus%20national%20under-23%20football%20team">Belarus</a> before being replaced by <a href="Gabriel%20%28footballer%2C%20born%20September%201992%29">Gabriel</a> as the nation went on to win the silver medal.
He was one of seven stand-by players named by <a href="Dunga">Dunga</a> for the <a href="Brazil%20national%20football%20team">senior team</a> at the <a href="2015%20Copa%20Am%C3%A9rica">2015 Copa América</a>, but was eventually called into the main squad after a knee injury to <a href="Diego%20Alves">Diego Alves</a>. Neto remained on the bench as <a href="Jefferson%20de%20Oliveira%20Galv%C3%A3o">Jefferson</a> played as first-choice goalkeeper, and Brazil reached the quarter-finals.
On 12 September 2018, eight years after his first senior call-up, Neto finally made his debut for Brazil when he started in a 5–0 <a href="Exhibition%20match%23Association%20football">friendly</a> win over <a href="El%20Salvador%20national%20football%20team">El Salvador</a> in the United States.
Honours.
Juventus
Valencia
Barcelona
Brazil U23
